programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E6 The V8 Interceptor: Nips, Tucks and 8 Stack The V8 Interceptor is back! Stacey answers your questions by walking you through the fitment of that massive Boss 9, 520ci engine in the ‘67 Cougar. Headers, oil pan, master cylinders, are addressed, but the big surprise is what is going on top. It’s an incredible 8-stack injection with the look and feel of a vintage Hilborne system, and the function and drive-ability of a modern electronic fuel injection. You have to see it to believe it, and when you do see it, you won’t believe it! Then Stacey goes through some tips and tricks for your fuel system that will keep you running down the road, and not sitting on the side of it! It’s all GEARZ…and it’s all here!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E7 Setting up the Ultimate Trailer – Towing Tech If there’s one thing that every gearhead needs, it’s a trailer so you can drag more junk home! The problem is, most of us don’t really put much thought into the set up of a trailer, and that can add up to some serious problems when you go to retrieve your prize. Today on GEARZ, Stacey walks you thru how to set up a simple trailer, so you’ll be ready to pull a rusted hulk out of a field, or pull a restoration from coast to coast. Compressed air, Winch, and auxiliary electric power are all things that you CAN take with you if you take the time to plan ahead and select the right equipment so it all works together. If you like to hunt for those forgotten treasures, a trailer is one tool you’ve got to have!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E8 The Ram 1500 Express Two of the biggest complaints that people have about the new Car manufacturers today, is that they don’t build the cars and trucks people want, and what they do build is too expensive. Well, never fear because today on GEARZ, Stacey introduces the new Ram 1500 Express that has a 390 horsepower 5.7 Hemi in a short bed, regular cab truck, and an price tag that will have you rubbing your eyes and pinching yourself to see if it is true. Better yet, there is a huge aftermarket out there to help you build a one of a kind vehicle. In 1968, Plymouth stood the muscle car world on its ear with the incredible Road Runner. In 2011,Mopar has done it again with the Ram 1500 Express…and GEARZ has the very first one… BEEP…BEEP!!!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E9 Speedway Motors/ Cherry Bomb Camaro When it comes to America, we all know who the founding Fathers are, and what their vision was for this Nation. When it comes to Hot Rodding, a lot of people have no idea who the founders are, and how this all got started. Today on GEARZ, Stacey gives you an up-close and personal look at the legendary, “Speedy” Bill Smith and the incredible world of Speedway Motors. Not only were they there from the beginning in the early ‘50’s, but they are still on the cutting edge and pulse of the Hot Rodding world. How do they do it???? You’ll have to watch and find out! After that, Stacey takes a look at the wild ’68 Camaro that Cherry Bomb has put together, to serve as their new way to disturb the Peace. CRANK IT UP!!!!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E10 V8 Miata Banshee Payoff It’s back! It’s done!! AND it’s WILD! The Banshee comes full circle as Stacey walks you thru the complete buildup of this incredible V8 powered Miata, and then takes it out for a good flogging! If you’ve ever dreamed of owning a Cobra or Corvette, but you needed something more reliable and affordable, this is one project you have to check out! If you’ve always considered the Mazda Miata a girl’s car…you HAVE to check this out! If you think that it’s impossible to have a reliable car with power windows, Air conditioning, and a real working top, that is ALSO blisteringly FAST…YOU HAVE TO CHECK THIS OUT! The best part is this is a car you can actually build and afford…and that’s what real Hot Rodding is all about!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E11 The Drag’N’ Wagon Stacey rolls the Ram 1500 Express back in the shop and starts to transform it into the Drag’N’ Wagon. Pulling on the legacy of the iconic Superbee, the Little Red Wagon wheelstander, and the current popularity of Dragon folklore, Stacey sets out to create a modern street machine from a lowly base pickup that anybody can afford. To get the rig to handle, a state-of-the-art air suspension is installed, along with massive brakes, and cool performance wheels and tires. One thing about this wagon…..it’s going to handle!!!! After that, it’s off to the dyno to see what kind of difference a spark plug can make in the performance of your engine.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S5 E12 Old Trucks and Other Junk Stacey rolls in an old ’67 Ford pickup that has been hacked on over the years, and shows how to get rid of the old afterthought floor shifter, and convert it to a column shift that will actually shift gears! After that, Stacey digs into one of the newest fuel injection units on the market and shows how easy it is to install, and then demonstrates how to shave the drip rail off of your muscle car. Finally, we answer the question: Is it possible to put chrome plating on aluminum or stainless steel? We take a trip to Advance plating in Nashville to find out. There’s so much stuff going on, you’re gonna need to watch this show twice!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E2 Breathing Fire into the Drag’N’Wagon – The New Face of Slot Cars/Carrera Today on GEARZ, Stacey brings back the Drag’N’Wagon to see if he can get the beast to breathe some fire! The first thing he puts on is an ATI supercharger system to get some air sucking in. Then adds some hotter coils to help light the flame…and finally slaps on a bigger exhaust system to help blow the air out. If you are wondering how to make a street beast out of an entry level truck, this show spells it out. Then it’s on to the world of slot cars, as Stacey explores the past, present, and future of the little motorized miniatures that helped shape the gearhead world as we know it and introduces you to Carrera slot cars.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E3 Super Cars, Kit Cars, and the SL-C Today on GEARZ, Stacey jumps into a project that’s bound to get everybody talking…a SUPERCAR that will run with the Ferraris and Lamborghinis that are out there. But, before he can show you HOW to build one, he has to show you how the whole supercar thing came into existence, and what it takes to build something that will run over 200mph…safely! If you’ve ever dreamed of owning a super car, and thought you couldn’t afford it…… this is a show you can’t afford to miss!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E4 Body Building the SL-C Quick…what is the first thing that comes to mine when I say, “kit Car”? Well, if It’s images of cheap poorly fitting bodies, bad engineering, and goofy looking cars, you are about to have your mind changed as Stacey continues building a true supercar, from a Kit, that’ll run over 200Mph! From assembling the chassis to installing the body, this show goes into the nuts and bolts of what it takes to hand-build a car in your garage, that will rival the best that the European Exotics have to offer. Only in America, and only on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E5 Build Your Own LS7 & Setting Up a Mid-Engine Drivetrain If you have ever dreamed of walking into a place like GM, and building your own engine using all their tools and equipment, you have to catch this episode of GEARZ, because that is exactly what Stacey does! With GM’s new build-your-own-crate-engine program, you are able to follow Stacey thru the process of building your own LS7 engine. Not only does it give you a great look at how these engines are built and manufactured, but it’ll also give you great incentive to get to GM and build your own! After that, Stacey goes thru the mysterious world of the transaxle, and how to set up a mid-engine car for mind-blowing performance. If you are not watching GEARZ, you’re missing out on a lot of things you haven’t seen before!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E6 Boosting the Ford EcoBoost & Buffing Paint One of the hottest new rigs on the market is the Ford F150 with the new 6 cylinder eco-boost engine. But is it all it can be? Well, today on GEARZ Stacey takes a new eco-boost powered Ford and shows you some simple upgrades that can boost performance AND fuel economy of this great new engine…..at a price you can afford. Then Stacey rolls in the nastiest, grungiest, barn-find Mustang that you can imagine and shows you the steps and tools required to buff an old nasty paint job back to life. Did we mention that this paint is BLACK!?! All to prove the point that if it can be done with a black car...it can be done with any car…and GEARZ is the show that shows you how to do it!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E8 Building a Brush Truck With all the makeovers going on these days, it may surprise you to find that there ARE groups out there that could REALLY use some help. The local volunteer Fire Department is a perfect example of this. Since they are volunteers, nobody gets paid the put their life on the line day in and day out, and the equipment they use is generally hand-me-down stuff from the bigger Fire Departments. Well today on GEARZ, Stacey decides to do something about that by taking a stock Chevy dually pickup, and transform it into a state-of-the-art Brush truck for the local Volunteer Fire Department. The cool thing is, he’s using a lot of aftermarket parts that YOU can use on your project…And if it’s good enough for Firemen that go into harm’s way, you KNOW it is good enough for what you will use it for. So strap in, and let’s go ride a Fire Truck!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E9 Hot Rod Station Wagon Station Wagons…Love them or hate them, we all have some stories to tell about them! But most of us have never dreamed that a wagon could be a Hot rod or cool custom…but they can! Today on GEARZ, Stacey shows how much fun a wagon can be when it has an LS engine under the hood, and two four barrel carburetors sitting on it. If you ever wanted to thrash your Dad’s old Wagon, this is the show for you! After that Stacey digs into some of the most asked questions regarding shooting waterborne paint, and finally we take a trip to Texas to see how one body-man created his own business by selling tools, instead of using them. If you are looking for a new career, this could be your answer.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E10 Sgt Rock Suspension When it comes to Cadillac’s, most people immediately think of lowering them down, and cruising with them. However, since the Cadillac Escalade is a great SUV, we thought it would be great to take the Escalade of Country artist Jason Sturgeon, and put a 3 ½” Skyjacker lift on it. Now you have no reason not to go hunting or fishing in style! After that we head to the land of the Predator, and see what it takes to be one of the most successful Monster Trucks of all time with Alan Pezo. Finally, we rub a little of that Monster Truck DNA on SGT. ROCK, as we upgrade the suspension and get it ready to do a little crushing of its own!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E11 Ram 1500 Longhorn/Katzkin Upholstery/ Schwartz Performance Everybody knows that you can get almost anything you want on a new car or truck these days. The problem is, if you use your truck for work, “almost” just doesn’t get it. Today on GEARZ, Stacey takes a decked out new truck, and adds some key tools and equipment to make it something that you can literally take to work or play with. After that, we dig into the mysterious world of leather interiors, and show how it is possible for you to buy a top quality leather upholstery kit, and install it yourself. Finally, we roll in the SL-C and show what it takes to put twin turbos on an LS7. It’s gonna be crazy, and it’s only gonna be on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E12 Stacey rolls Heavy Metal back into the shop and begins to lay out some of the incredible modifications that he is going to be doing on this old junk yard ’69 International Cab over truck. A custom four-link air suspension goes on first, and then a slick air brake system to pull this big monster to a stop. A custom exhaust is also laid out, along with numerous other modifications to make this a one of a kind rig. If you have ever wondered if a Cab over could make a cool hot rod, you need to check this out. From there it’s off to the movies as Stacey digs into the impact and influence movie cars have on our lives and culture. To prove that point, He brings in actor Dax Shepard and his cool ’67 Lincoln Continental who are both starring in the new movie “Hit and Run”. So strap in and hold on, ‘cuz we might get airborne on this ride!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E13 Foxbody Mustang Stick Shift Swap & V8 Interceptor Paint and Body Everybody knows that 80’s and 90’s cars are hot right now, and one of the most desirable is the Fox bodied Mustang because it’s cheap and offers incredible bang for the buck. Today on GEARZ, Stacey rolls in a 1990 Mustang cop car and shows how easy it is to pull out an automatic tranny, and stuff in a Tremec 6spd so you can shift the gears properly. Then it’s off to the Hot Rod Institute in South Dakota to see the paint and body work that the instructors and students have been doing to the V8 Interceptor. If you thought this ’67 Cougar was wild before, wait ‘til you see this show! Here Kitty,…..Kitty……Kitty….

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S6 E14 Modifying a Polaris Ranger UTV/Side-By-Side One of the hottest vehicles to hit the gear head world is the Side-by-Side, or Utility Vehicle. Once relegated to just farm or ranch work, the UTV is now something that you will see being used for Hunting, Fishing, Camping, Landscaping….virtually ANY kind of outdoor work or recreation. Of course that means the aftermarket is full of things to make an UTV better. Today on GEARZ, Stacey takes a Polaris Ranger and decks it out with a 3 ½” lift, bigger tires and axles, winches front and rear, and all kinds of other cool things to build an all-terrain vehicle that will really shine on the trail or off. After that he gives you a sneak peek at the new Ironworker that has everybody talking. If you work a lot with metal, you need this machine!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E1 Drving the Drag N Wagon Stacey puts a programmer on the Drag ‘N’ Wagon to finally bring the stripped down Ram Hot Rod truck to life. If you’ve been wondering what kind of performance potential these new Ram Express trucks have, wait until you see one lit up with a supercharger! Talk about breathing fire! After that Stacey lays out how to set up a shop with custom flooring, custom cabnets, and of course a lot of tools and toolboxes. If you’ve ever wondered about the best way to lay out a shop, and utilize your space, this is the show to see… and GEARZ is the show to watch!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E2 Hot Rod Tow Truck Project Heavy Metal is back as Stacey rolls the International Cabover truck into the shop so he can outfit it with a vintage Holmes dual wrecker bed. The big truck continues to come together using parts from a junkyard wrecker, swap meet vintage beer kegs, and some new aftermarket parts. If you always thought that you had to spend big money to build a unique vehicle, this “Heavy Metal” truck will change your mind, and probably have you digging through junkyards in hopes of finding a vintage truck of your own!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E3 Long Bed Into Short Bed Everybody wants a classic short bed pickup. Unfortunately, short beds are hard to find for a good price… but long beds are a dime-a-dozen, and cheap! The solution?... chop a long bed down! That is exactly what Stacey does on this episode of GEARZ. He takes a classic 67 Chevy long bed, and walks you through the way to cut the frame properly, so you have a safe and reliable truck when you are done. If you’ve heard about this kind of modification, but always thought it was too difficult or involved for you to do, you need to watch this episode of GEARZ and let the cutting begin!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E4 Monn Buggy Race Who put men on the moon? If you answered “Gearheads” then you are right… of course, we call them engineers and rocket scientists now. But that doesn’t change the fact that a bunch of hot rodders figured out how to get America into Space, and Stacey takes a look at the roots of the Space Program, and the invention of the moon buggy. Then it’s out to the NASA testing grounds to see the annual Moon buggy race. If you think you’ve seen some weird projects, wait until you see what some of these young minds have dreamed up. You may think you’re on another planet, but you’re not… you’re watching GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E5 Short Bed Classic Truck Stacey picks up right where he left off a few weeks ago and proceeds to install a brand new short bed, on the chassis of a truck that was born a LONG BED. That’s right, with the cutting done, the next step is to assemble a new short bed using all new aftermarket parts. You hear people say, “if it was that easy, everybody would be doing it!” Well, it IS that easy, and a lot of people ARE doing it… and YOU need to be one of them! Now… chop to it!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E6 P38 Lightning It was one of the most lethal airplanes of WWII… the P-38 Lightning. Stacey takes a look at what made it so unique and why the German army nicknamed it the “Forked tailed devil”. But the legend didn’t end in the 1940’s… it continues on as Stacey showcases the new P-38 engine parts from Jon Kaase that you can put on your small block Ford to make it run like greased lightning! After that, Stacey sits down with Rock and Roll legend and certified car nut, James Burton, to dig into the unique connection between cars, guitars, and Rock and roll. Turn it on… crank it up… and hold on!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E7 Lawn & Garden Some of the most neglected tools around the house are lawn and garden tools. Mowers, weed-eaters, chain saws, etc. all usually get thrown in a garage in the fall, never to be touched again until spring. Stacey walks through the simple steps on how to care for those tools, so they give you years of trouble free service. After that, He goes through the many parts you will need to put a manual transmission into a project, with Transmission Tech. Finally, if you’re looking for a simple project to do over the weekend, how about a muffler swap? You say “no”?... Stacey says “yes.”.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E8 V8 Interceptor Paint and Body The V8 Interceptor is BACK and wearing a striking coat of glossy black paint! How did it happen? Well, Stacey walks you through the process and shows off the incredible paint and body work that was done by the Hot Rod Institute. From the subtle body nips and tucks, to the major fabrication of a new roof, this classic Cougar now has a straighter body than anything that may have rolled off the assembly line in 1967! But the paint is only half the story, as Stacey starts to re-assemble the car with bumpers, lights and engine, you start to get a good look at what is rapidly becoming the ultimate street predator!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E9 Heavy Metal Winches What is cooler than a vintage tow truck? … Nothing! Stacey proves that point by rolling Heavy Metal back into the GEARZ shop to outfit it with new electric winches, and an amazing custom tool box and light bar. This ’69 International cabover truck may have been rescued from a junkyard, but it won’t be long before this truck starts pulling off rescues of its own! This is recycling at it’s best! Then ride along with Stacey and crew as they travel to Minnesota and get the story on Edwards Manufacturing and how they have managed to stay in business for over a hundred years building simple tools. It’s all good, and it’s all GEARZ!!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E10 Ray Barton Story When you say “HEMI”, you get people’s attention! But when you say “Ray Barton HEMI” you win races. Stacey and crew take you to Ray Barton Racing Engines to show you the amazing engines and parts they build, and why they go so fast. After that, Stacey digs into the interior of the V8 Interceptor and shows what kind of options you have when you are restoring or customizing the interior of your project. You’ll love the custom PRS guitar and matching wood dash and steering wheel! There is no doubt that this Cougar is the perfect blend of brutal power, and sophisticated elegance.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E11 Sgt. Rock Exhaust Stacey rolls in SGT. ROCK to take care of steering, brakes, and the exhaust system. With a quick trip to Stainless Works for a custom set of headers and exhaust system, and with the layout of the four-wheel hydraulic steering, it won’t be long before this big military beast is rolling under its own power. After that, he takes on the seat in Heavy Metal tow truck. Just because a project may have come out of a junkyard, doesn’t mean it has to look like junk. Stacey proves that by adding a custom bomber-style seat to this already VERY unique vehicle… this episode of GEARZ is the one to see!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E12 Moby Duck Stacey sets out to build a nice hunting rig out of a 2012 GMC 4x4 truck. But this rig belongs to John Godwin of Duck Commander, which means the truck will be spending some serious time on the road… and off… hunting for ducks. On goes a 6” lift, 35” tall tires, and massive bumpers and winch to pull this big white beast out of any mud holes it may end up in. And since it IS such a big white beast, it is only fitting that Stacey name this project “Moby Duck”! If you’ve ever wondered if it’s possible to have a daily driver, that can also be a nice hunting, fishing, or outdoor rig. This episode of GEARZ will show you how to do it.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S7 E13 Super Car, Hot Rods, Go Carts Stacey rolls the SL-C back into the shop to show off the twin turbo system Schwartz Performance installed. If you thought 1000hp out of an LS-7 was impossible, THINK AGAIN! Even wilder is the fact that this engine is pulling that kind of horsepower on pump gas! If supercars and twin turbos are your thing, you have to see this! After that, Stacey goes through some of the problem areas that you will face when you are building a vehicle and how to pick the right project. Finally He digs into the 1st motorized vehicle that most of us had…the Go-Kart. There's something for everybody in this show. That’s why they call it GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E1 Building A Shop We dig into the ultimate how-to project… building a shop! It’s an incredible transformation as Stacey and Crew take a huge open warehouse and build it into the new GEARZ shop. Along the way you’ll pick up all kinds of tips and tricks that Stacey uses when he’s setting up a useable work space. With today’s economy, there are more and more people thinking about opening a shop, or converting their existing garage space into a more useable area. This show can help you do that. After that, Stacey shows how to stop rust dead in its tracks by using the simplest tool in the box… a paint brush! It’s all here on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E2 The Gearz Express Stacey makes a house call… to Pennsylvania! Why?... to pick up an old fire truck to use as a project truck to make even more house calls with! If this sounds confusing, then you NEED to see this show, because Stacey shows you how to take a vehicle that nobody really has a use for anymore, and convert it into something you can use for your home or business. Sound deadening, tool boxes, and an on-board air system are all things that you’ll see go on as the big green fire truck, begins the conversion into a rolling tool truck.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E3 100th Episode Pt. 1 It’s anniversary time…the 100th episode of GEARZ! And we have put together a one-hour special of the history and making of GEARZ, in two episodes! Stacey takes a look back at how the show came about. Then he digs into some of the project vehicles, and looks at the ideas and reasoning that shaped these trend-setting vehicles. If you’re new to GEARZ or wondered how the show was put together, this episode will shed some light on that.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E4 100th Episode Pt. 2 Part two of the 100th Episode special starts with a bang and a lot of tire smoke, as Stacey looks back at some of the wild test drives and feature vehicles that have been on GEARZ over the years. After that, they go behind the scenes and show you some of the funny and potentially dangerous situations that can happen when you work on a show like GEARZ. Finally, we showcase some of the incredible guests that have been on the show, to give you an idea of what to expect in the future. It’s all here and only on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E5 Wrapping The Beast Stacey rolls in the big green fire truck, with every intention of changing the color and look. But he’s not using paint… he’s using a vinyl wrap! If you’ve ever wondered what the deal is with vinyl wraps and if it is a good thing to do to your project, you need to see this show! But that’s not all, as the wrap is going on, Stacey also takes the time to show how to restore and bring back to life your accessories and trim without spending a lot of money.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E6 Richard Petty If you’ve been around cars very much, you’ve heard the term “barn find”. It depicts that “diamond in the rough” vehicle that everybody wants to find. Stacey delves into the barn find phenomenon and unveils what could be the ultimate barn find… the lost Richard Petty Car! Follow the incredible story of the car that Richard and Maurice Petty built in their early days, that was then sold and disappeared for decades... only to be found by Stacey and returned to Richard Petty so it could take its rightful place in the Petty Museum. It’s gearhead archeology at its best, and you’ll only see it on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E7 On The Road Stacey hits the road to visit a GEARZNation member to see if he can lend a hand on his project. The owner is a 16-year-old kid and the subject is his ’96 Dodge pickup that’s looking a little rough from years of use and abuse. That quickly changes as Stacey jumps in to help give the truck a new face, and at the same time offers tips and tricks to breathe a breath of fresh air into the project. See what a difference some time, expertise, and a few parts can make on a beat up old truck! After that, Stacey takes a look at the amazing Moduline Cabinets, and digs into what makes them so great.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E8 LMC Casey James Bronco Stacey shows you how to tackle the one restoration project that everybody dreams of doing one day... the frame off restoration! You’ll be surprised how simple a job like this can be if you follow his simple tips and tricks and plan the project out properly. In the world of high dollar builds, a simple frame off restoration can get you back on the road enjoying your car or truck and at a fraction of the price. But to get a grasp on how to do it, you have to see this show. After that, Stacey swaps some licks with recording artist Casey James who just happens to be a gearhead at heart… all here… all Gearz!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E9 Custom Bumper Mounts So, you think you want some custom bumpers for your big ol’ truck? Stacey shows you how to find what you’re looking for in the aftermarket, and also how to fabricate and build your own custom mounts to make ‘em sit exactly where you want them. After that he digs into the history of the Sgt. Rock truck and how it is permanently connected to “the greatest generation”. But this truck isn’t just about WWII, as a special tailgate airbrushed by Mickey Harris reveals, It’s about the men and women that have sacrificed for the freedoms we enjoy today. This is one show that will have you waving the flag!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E10 On The Road Again Stacey hits the road to help out a Gearz Nation member with his ‘56 Corvette project. Since the guy really wants to drive the car, putting in a modern 5 or 6spd tranny would be really nice. But which one? Well, we not only answer that question, but also give the guy a little helping hand with the transmission too. If you’ve ever wished Stacey made house calls, this is the show to see. After that we take a look at some serious questions that people ask about becoming a tool dealer and if it’s really worth it. You wanted to know… we got the answers for you!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E11 The Street Sweeper Stacey dives into the world of the sleeper, by taking a non-descript ’73 Plymouth Satellite, and begins transforming it into a street pounding monster under the skin. Gone is the lethargic 318 engine and front suspension, and in its place Stacey begins fitting a new state of the art performance suspension. It you are into surprising people at stop lights and run-what-you-brung race nights, then a “Street Sweeper” just might be the sort of approach you want to take on your next project.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E12 Street Sweeper E3 Testing The Street Sweeper is back! Stacey delves into just how many parts it takes to completely change the drivetrain and suspension on a classic muscle car. Accessories, transmission, overdrive, headers, the list may seem to go on forever, but it’s all about finding the right parts in the aftermarket, to build the car that YOU want. After that it’s off to the races to see if E3’s new top fuel spark plug can handle the pressure of competition. If you want to see the ins and outs of building a car, GEARZ is the show to see!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S8 E13 Street Sweeper Interior If you could only do one upgrade on your vehicle, that would make the biggest impact on the looks and drivability, what would it be? Stacey answers that question by installing a Katzkin leather interior into a Jeep Compass, and showing that if you’ve got an open weekend and a few hundred bucks, you can do the same thing on your car or truck. After that, he jumps back onto the Street Sweeper project to lay out the interior and the rearend, and finally drop that huge Hemi into place. If you’ve ever thought it would be fun to build a sleeper car, this is one ’73 Plymouth Satellite that shows how it can be done!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E1 NAPA Perfect Additions Truck Stacey Preps the bed of the NAPA Perfect additions truck. From rolling out Herculiner to installing transfer tank, truck boxes, and even a combination generator/compressor, this big Ford begins its Perfect Additions transformation. He also throws in a wiring tech that will keep you from getting your wires crossed.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E2 NAPA Perfect Additions Truck 2 Stacey tackles power gains at the air intake, modifies the computer and replaces the stock exhaust before addressing a 2” front-end suspension lift kit. He moves on to give the truck some extra height and support in the rear of the truck where payload weight can be a serious issue. After the suspension is in place, new wheels and tires bring the truck back down to the ground. Stacey also covers several tools that will help you get that old exhaust out from under your vehicle.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E3 Junkyard Jag Stacey leads the crew on a hunt for a junkyard Jaguar with a rare engine. Pin-striping legend Von Hot Rod comes to the GearZ studio and lays down some lines on a hot rod guitar. Need to repair or replace the door on your pick up? Stacey’s got a handle on that. A bed lifter system turns a four-man operation into a one-man show. And Stacey’s got a steering column that will keep Falcon owners between the lines. All this and more!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E5 Evolution Worlds Fastest Cat Stacey tells the story of the legendary Cheetah and how that car was designed to beat Shelby’s famed Cobra. The GEARZ hunt for this iconic race car features the original ’63 Cheetah that Budd Clusserath drove 215 mph at Daytona in ‘64. But the story doesn’t end there, because Stacey gets his hands on a Cheetah Evolution and shows you how to build your own version of this tire shredding cat! After that, you’ll see Steering wheel options from Grant, a serpentine belt system from LMC Truck, and Wizard products to make your vehicle come alive, as well as a quick tip to get things rolling in your shop. All this and more on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E6 Put A Heart In The Cat Moving deeper into the build of the Cheetah Evolution, Stacey and the crew pull the skin off this cat and start putting in the guts. Overviews of suspension, steering, and brakes get this project up and running. Moving into the heart of this beast, Stacey shows us that good things do come in small packages—the LSX 454 small block is sure to get your pulse rate up. And once the transmission is mounted, look out! Headers follow, and this cat is almost ready to run. Stacey’s tool tech will give you a lift… all this and more on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E7 Cheetah Paws A road trip, an overview of the Cheetah interior including seat and dash installation, rear lights and a tool tech. The GearZ crew heads out on the prowl to visit a budding young mechanic with a passion for 4X4’s. Back in the garage, Stacey gets in tight with the Cheetah, installing seats and the dash. Selecting gauges and placement are discussed, an AC unit will help keep this cat cool, taillights are fitted, and the side pipes will give this Cheetah some growl! Stacey’s tool tech will keep your project on time and on budget. And Fast Orange cleans more than your hands. All this on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E8 Beaten & Downtrodden Auction cars and what you might really find out once the car is in your garage: suspension, brakes and electrical concerns. In the current fad of “flipping” cars for cash, Stacey takes on the good, bad, and ugly of a ’66 Biscayne that was bought at auction. Nice looking paint can’t hide the safety issues that are found once this car is put on the lift. From suspension, to brakes, to battery cables… and even down to the lug nuts, this auction beauty turns out to be more of a beast. Safety and sport-style handling are only a few repairs away this week on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E9 Automotive Icon Turns 40 Stacey and the crew head north to celebrate 40 years of Heartthrob Exhaust and see just how far this company has come since its modest beginnings in a garage. After that we dig into a cracked dash and show how easy it is to replace one yourself with some aftermarket parts from LMC Truck, and then we look at a painless solution will help clean up years of spliced wires and old electrical tape that might be lurking under your hood. It’s simple gearhead stuff that everybody needs to know and it’s only on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E10 Cheetah Gets Her Growl Stacey digs back into the Cheetah project by finishing up the stance with custom wheels and tires, and then goes through the ins and outs of putting a classic Hilborn fuel injection on a modern LS engine… and the dyno numbers show that the engine likes it as much as you will! After that Stacey sits down with a budding car designer that is making a big impact everywhere he goes and there’s also a tip on the importance of seals and gaskets. It’s all about getting out and turning wrenches, and you’re only gonna find it on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E11 Curves On Wheels Stacey explores the history of the legendary Jaguar D-type racecar and introduces a D-type Jag from Race Car Replicas that is sure to become a legend of its own. From race wheels to classic spoke wheels with true knock-offs, Stacey looks at options for getting the best look and most rubber on the road with this Jag. A tip might keep you from losing your mind when dealing with lug nuts that don’t want to budge and we talk shop about performance parts for your own cars. So, come hang out while we take on a legendary cat of a different color this week on GearZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E12 New Bed Old Ford Stacey and the crew hit the ground running with a late model replacement bed from LMC that’s sure to revive and old Ford farm truck and get it out of the pastures and back on the highway. Then it’s off to show budding Jeep enthusiasts a couple of entry level options they can use when it comes to modifying their vehicle. We get a visit from a couple who learn how to install new seat upholstery. Stacey’s found something cool for all you second generation Camaro owners. And we’re just getting started! So get ready to turn some wrenches on GearZ.

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S9 E13 Gearz On The Road The GearZ crew and Cornwell Tools team up to help a new shop in Arkansas get some much-needed tools to help them take they’re shop the next level. Then Stacey puts together the final pieces of the Sgt. Rock project by making a trip to France and the beaches of Normandy. Then it’s back to the shop to show you how easy it is to put fuel injection on your muscle car. It’s all here… and only on GEARZ!

programme.title: Stacey David's Gearz
programme.desc: S10 E1 Nuts Bolts Building Sgt Rock Season 10 Starts off with America’s favorite military tribute truck! Sgt. Rock is back and ready for final assembly! Garage Guru, Stacey David, takes us on a tour de force of custom fabrication as he covers all the nuts and bolts of what it’s taken to get Sgt. Rock ready to rumble. Builders of all levels are in for a great show as Stacey tackles one of a kind steering columns, gas pedals and designing a console that not only fits form, but also function. Gauge techs will keep your instrument panels in line. And a quick tip will keep your wires from fraying and your hoses from splitting. All this and more as Sgt. Rock and Season 10 hit the road full throttle.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S9 E11 A Challenger Reflected The Ghoulz have finished the 1970 Challenger R/T SE. As they take it out for the first test drive in over 15 years, Mark and the team reflect on the trials and challenges throughout the restoration process.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S9 E12 Mark, Dougie, Allysa, Oh My! Mark, Dougie, and Allysa team up to kick things into high-gear around the shop. They begin the restoration of a Challenger T/A, Will paints a 1968 GTX in B7 Blue, Allysa learns how dashes are assembled, and they install the drivetrain for the ultra rare, 1 of 2, 1970 Hemi Convertible Coronet R/T.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S9 E13 Shaking the Magic 8-Ball Mark pulls back the curtain on the next four Mopar’s in desperate need of resurrection while also showcasing the fans favorite moments from Seasons 8 and 9.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E1 Rapping Up the Dash Mark and the Ghouls are back, and they are ready to get to work! With a call in from the owner of the super rare 1 of 2 ever made, 1970 Coronet Hemi Convertible, Mark has to work fast to reach a looming deadline. At the same time, Will primes the body of our 1969 Daytona, bringing it one step closer to being back on the road.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E2 Everybody Loves Raymond While Mark is on a road test of the just completed 1968 Charger, its owner surprises the shop by arriving in person! While the owner waits, Will completes the paint on a beautiful 1970 Challenger in B5 blue. Finally, with Mark returned the owner receives his restored Charger and cooks a meal for the Ghouls as thanks!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E3 Upshift Creek It’s time to hit the casino! Mark has been invited to a massive car show at the Little Creek Casino but before he can go there are a few things that need to be finished first. Mark and Doug disassemble the Phoenix ‘Cuda, a car that survived a massive garage fire. At the car show, Allysa and Will interact with fans and find their “pick of the show.”.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E4 It's A Duster Buster Mark has once again taken Allysa under his wing and is teaching her the finer points of installing a grill and headlights on our 1972 Duster, meanwhile George is in the body shop attaching a tricky quarter panel to a 1969 ‘Cuda which Mark has to check off the list…military style? Finally, the Duster gets it’s drive train and is finally reunited with its engine.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E5 Carbituary: Charger Who better to explain the history and discuss the changes, year to year, of the Dodge Charger, than the Master of Mopar himself, Mark Worman. In this special episode of Graveyard Carz, Mark will show you unique differences, surprising insights, and cool features on multiple years of the same car: the Dodge Charger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E6 1.5 Million Dollar Baby The focus has shifted, with parts having arrived at the shop it’s time to install the Grill, Bumper, Dash and Interior of our 1968 Turbine Bronze Charger. Mark and the Ghouls work their magic on the Charger until a familiar face shows up. With Royal there, Mark shifts the crew back to the 1 of 2 1970 Coronet and finishes the interior. Then, it’s time for a test drive!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E7 Willie, Paint it Black? With SEMA 2018 looming on the horizon, it’s time to address the elephant in the room. Mark’s 1964 A100 Hemi truck, the Little Dead Wagon, built as an homage to Bill Maverick’s Little Red Wagon. Will is set to prime and paint, but has a disagreement with Mark over the color. When the engine for the A100 shows up it’s time to unbox one of the most powerful engines Graveyard Carz has ever put in a car!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E8 The A100 Team Mark and the Ghouls get down to work like never before in order to get the A100 ready for SEMA which is only weeks away. Brakes, suspension, tail lights, bed sealer, you name it and the Mopar Maniacs are racing to get it done. With time flying and stress mounting the team works long hours and weekends trying to finish this iconic build. With SEMA only days away, the A100 finally gets it’s iconic 426 HEMI engine, well, if they can make it fit!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E9 Night of the Little Dead Wagon There is no time left, SEMA is almost here but the iconic A100 still needs some buttoning up. Installing all of the final components is an all hands on deck task and when the dust settles, Mark has only the decals left to put on the car, completing its legendary look. With the A100 finished the team heads out to SEMA in order to roll the Little Dead Wagon over the red carpet for Mopar and Mark once again receives a very kind gift from our friends.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E10 Carbiturary: Cuda When Mark get’s started talking about a car there is almost no stopping him. So it is again when Mark picks multiple years of a favorite Mopar of his and tells both the audience, and whoever will listen all about their amazing options and cool differences. The Ghouls join in on the fun just like last time to pick their favorite things as well. Don’t worry, though, he can’t talk forever right?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E11 Duster In The Wind With SEMA over the Ghoulz can finally rest and get back to work on all the cars they had to leave untouched for the last few weeks…again. First up on deck is our beautiful 1972 Duster. Needing its Dash installed as well as its interior there is still a lot of work left on this car! Additionally, metal work has begun on a host of new cars moving up through the shop, it never stops at Graveyard Carz.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E12 B5: Before & After A 1970 Challenger is a special thing, but a B5 Challenger is even more special. With the bumblebee stripe finally added to the car it’s time for the work to really begin. Work begins on all the things that make this 1970 Challenger special, including the headliner, dash, interior and more. With that done it’s time for this beautiful Challenger to get its 440 Six Pack!

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S10 E13 The Last WS27R on Earth The time has finally come. Brett Torino is coming and he is here for his car, the legendary 1 of 2 ever made, 1970 Coronet! Mark wouldn’t be Mark, though, without a few tricks up his sleeve. When Brett arrives to collect on his long restoration from the Mopar Master, the reveal of this truly one of a kind car is done with style. But not before Mark takes us back through the entire restoration leading up to that point. It Is the last 1970 Hemi Coronet Convertible on earth, after all.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E1 Emma's Car The crew is overwhelmed with several restorations at once. From painting stripes, to engine parts, to missing parts on the 71 Charger, tensions are high around the shop. To Make things worse, Mark is obsessed with finding a factory pink Mopar for his granddaughter's 16th birthday.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E2 It's the Great Pumpkin, Mark Worman! The crew at Graveyard Carz are excited about the pumpkin carving contest, but when a mistake leaves the 'Cuda filled with water, the whole crew has to pay the price. Royal saves the day, but with the carving contest back on the table, where are the pumpkins? Mark has to swallow his pride and accept help from Daren for the contest to go ahead.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E3 Daren Goes Plum Crazy Daren is given control of the shop for a week. Darenʼs constant pestering and ribbing leads Mark to hand him the reigns of Graveyard Carz for a week. But instead of getting things done, Daren starts inventing new field trips and distractions for the crew, as well as becoming obsessed with getting his personal Dodge Challenger running again.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E4 Runnin' Down a Dream Mark receives an angry call from the owner of the 1970 Roadrunner, which leads to a mad rush to get the car finished in time. Meanwhile, Josh pushes the crew into committing to some New Years resolutions.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E5 More than a Wrench Frustrated by the crew's complaints that he spends all day being lazy in the front office. Mark is determined to prove to the guys that there is more to restoring a car than physical labor. Josh and Daren visit the crash site of the mangled orange 1971 'Cuda.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E6 The Big Dipper As the team works to complete a multitude of cars, Mark stresses over the metal dipping of the very rare and valuable ʻ71 Cuda 440-6. Tensions are high and time is limited, is the GYC crew up to the pressure?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E1 It's Alive The ghouls get the remains back from the '71 440 Six Barrel, 4 Speed, Shaker Hood Phantom Cuda and determine if the car can be resurrected. A '69 Dodge Daytona Charger arrives ready to be brought back from the dead and Mark gets a 2011 SRT8 Dodge Challenger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E2 Six-Pack to Go The ghouls get the N96 Air Grabber installed on the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car. It's started and is ready for final assembly. The owners of '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car visit to check on the restoration progress.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E3 Hey, Charger! Mark is hired to restore the body, paint, and suspension of a '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car. The shop gets some needed upgrades and the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car is completed to OEM Specifications.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E4 Wet Paint The '70 Sunroof Challenger is painted and ready for final assembly. The '69 Daytona Charger is disassembled and readied to be shipped to the media blasters. Mark and the Ghoulz head out to the junkyard to blow off some steam playing paintball.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E5 Factory Correct Mark and the Ghoulz use their brand new Shop Crane to lower the body of the '71 Cuda 340 Triple Black 'Phantasm' Tribute car onto its restored suspension and its drive-train is assembled and installed.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E6 Holley Equipped The '69 Daytona Charger returns from the media blaster and Mark gives Josh a history lesson on the '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel Car before removing it's drive-train and suspension.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: S2 E1 Daily Driver Transformation Part 1 Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how to detail an engine bay, deep clean wheels and tires, paint decontamination, and headlight restoration on a 10 year old daily driver.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: S2 E2 Daily Driver Transformation Part 2 Nick Rutter showcases the products and process to restore the finish of a 10-year-old vehicle using a rotary and dual action polisher, protecting with a graphene ceramic coating and also restores the faded plastic trim.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S9 E13 Cold Air, Hot Rod We tackle an A/C cooling problem on a Toyota Tacoma and introduce you to Kevin’s Hot Rod BMW.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S9 E14 LSM3 Kevin and Bryan continue the work on Kevin’s LSM3 project.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S9 E15 Inside the Cat Kevin travels to Indiana to solve the mysteries of the catalytic converter.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S9 E16 Cool Tools Kevin and Bryan show some cool tools and shop tips while working on Kevin’s Hot Rod BMW.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S9 E17 Boating Maintenance Kevin services a tournament series high performance boat while Bryan welds up a new casting platform.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S9 E18 Monster Transmission Auto Show Kevin and Bryan hit the road and take in a classic auto show and take a tour at Monster Transmission and Performance.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E1 Power Steering Upgrade Kevin and Bryan show us the proper way to upgrade the power steering system on an older vehicle and offer some other useful maintenance tips.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E2 Open House at Surf City Bryan takes a trip to Huntington Beach, CA to learn some new detailing tips from the pros.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E1 Doubling Down A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Century Race “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E3 Motorcycle Crime Story “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E4 100 Year Old Harley “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E5 Davenport Swap A thousand bulging barns of choppers, bobbers, and board trackers are emptied and on display in the Quad Cities.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E6 Peashooter A vague tip leads Matt and Dale into a WWII era military warehouse and beyond.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E7 Hidden Hillclimbers A cross-country race to lay claim to some of the world’s most sought after works specials.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E8 12 Hours and Running “12hrs. & Running”: Dale turns a surprise 60th birthday party into a challenge to his guests to start 120 of the rarest motorcycles in the world.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E1 Diamond in Dodge City An family farm in the mid-west contains houses, barns, outbuildings, trailers, grain silos and buses full of old stuff and perhaps the biggest stash of undiscovered old motorcycles in the country. The collection was put together by their unnamed father. Seller agrees to have Dale broker rare Excelsior for high-end client. Dale has the buyer, but will he outbid his own client for the exclusive find?

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E2 Don't Tell Dale Matt is out for revenge. Last year Dale beat him badly at the Annual Vintage bike race in Barber, Alabama. But this year there is a whole new tale to tell. With just days until the race - Dale is secretly struggling to get the bike he beat Matt with last year up and working. Matt struggles just to locate a 100-year old bike. Matt's prayers are answered thanks to an old Catholic Priest he located who has possession of a bike. The priest might let Matt have the bike to race - but there are conditions. The toughest one: Don't tell Dale you have it. Can Matt afford to buy the bike and get it running in time for the race without Dale seeing it? Will Dale even get his broken bike started? And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E3 Biker Lore Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E4 Vegas Payday Big Time Motorcycle Auction.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E5 Second Time's a Charm The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E6 Wounded Warrior Project Home Depot Senior Vice President, Gordon Erickson, is a huge fan of Wheels Through Time. He is also a huge supporter of the Wounded Warrior program. For years the hardware giant has been donating goods and services to help returning servicemen with their fix-it-up projects. Now they would like to go one step further and build a WWII military bike to raise awareness and funds. Only problem is where to get one? Enter Dale and an exhaustive, time sensitive, cross country search for a rare military machine.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E7 Orphan Bikes Promoters of the prestigious Amelia Island Concours have called on Dale to develop a show and field bikes for an “Orphan Bike” show. They have defined orphan bike as extremely rare, that aren't a Harley nor Indian machines.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E8 Time is Not On Their Side For Dale and Matt sometimes the dotted line to treasure splits and heads in opposite directions. In this edition of What’s in the Barn, time is thrust to the forefront of this multi-state, long distance, north, south search. Timeless and priceless 110 year old bikes, antique cars, airplanes, and the infamous Egberts 1930 neon Harley-Davidson sign that coined the phrase “Ride a Winner” are high on this father and son’s list of “must haves”. The clock ticks, both literally and figuratively, on one rare time piece and two old-timer’s cars, bikes, and automobiles.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E1 Doubling Down A California collector gambles on a big payday from his Crocker/Caddy combo.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E2 The Century Race “The Century Race”: Dale believes he found the bike that will help him beat a rival in an annual race of 100 year old motorcycles. But will it run?

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E3 Motorcycle Crime Story “A Motorcycle Crime Story”: The horrific tale of a double murder over money and motorcycles.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S1 E4 100 Year Old Harley “Yes, Dale there is a 100 Year Old Harley”: Dale hopes his labor of love becomes a prized possession when a six-figure Harley goes to auction.

And if they ever get to race, will Matt exact his revenge?

programme.desc: S2 E3 Biker Lore Built in the mid-60’s by eccentric engineer “Wild Bill” Gelbke, the Road Dog was, and still is, the largest motorcycle ever built. It utilized aircraft tubing, Corvette disc brakes, and a Chevy truck differential to keep it stable. The one-off creation disappeared when Gelbke did in 1978. Outflanked once when the bike was spotted and sold to a private collector in 1995, Dale has vowed to locate the machine and make Wheels Through Time its final resting place.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E4 Vegas Payday Big Time Motorcycle Auction.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E3 BREAK UP TO MAKEUP From break up to make up, Jeff Gordon and Ray reunite to go on a quest to find their Chevrolet Monte Carlo that claimed victory in their final race together at Phoenix, AZ in 1999. John Bickford, Jeff Gordon’s stepdad, makes the call that reunites the old team. Jeff and Ray look to bum parts off their boss, Rick Hendrick, to make their vision a reality: get the car, replace the parts as they were, make it run and get it to auction.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E4 BATTLE FOR ROME One of the greatest battles in NASCAR history was Hall of Famer Richie Evans and rival speedster Jerry Cook. Ray is determined to uncover and revive the cars that made these men famous.Ray purchases one of Richie’s original #61 modifieds from Jimmy Spencer and restores it to its original glory while simultaneously building a replica of Jerry Cook’s #38. Throughout the build process, Ray uncovers stories about these legends through the eyes of guys who were in Rome, NY to witness it firsthand, like Robin Pemberton and Steve Hmiel.Both cars will hit the track at Martinsville, site of one of the greatest races in modified history and the tragic death of Richie Evans himself. Legends live again, as Ray recreates one of the racing world’s most celebrated rivalries on a track that has seen it all.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E5 SECRETS OF GM General Motors VP of global design Ed Welburn takes AmeriCarna behind the scenes to talk about the history and development of the company’s concept cars that never made it to production. In a rare tour of the factory’s inner design studio, Ray gets an exclusive look behind the creative curtain at the GM plant in Detroit.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E6 FIRST MUSTANG In this episode, Ray celebrates the 50th birthday of the Ford Mustang through the lens of three distinct Mustang owners, who each hold a slice of the car’s incredible history. In 1964, Chicago schoolteacher Gail Wise unknowingly purchased the first ever Mustang 3 days before the car became available to the general public. Her husband reveals the incredible restoration that brought the earliest Mustang ever sold back to its 60’s glory. (Ford Motor Company knows she has the car and has verified it was sold before it was legal to sell.) John Grafelman is a farmer in Illinois and life-long Ford lover. A few years ago he found an old car hidden in a barn. It took some time, but he eventually convinced his friend to sell it to him. After some detective work, he discovers he purchased 1968 Ford Design Chief Larry Shinoda’s personal car that he tinkered with to invent the BOSS 302.Lastly, Ray travels to Dayton Ohio to interview Gale Holderman, the Ford stylist who won the company’s contest to draw and design the Mustang.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E7 FORGOTTEN FIBERGLASS Post-World War II, a large generation of American soldiers was looking for cars that mirrored the incredible sports cars they saw overseas in Europe. After searching for an affordable way to recreate these cars, one manufacturer responded with a durable, cost effective option: a line of fiberglass sports cars. Very few of these cars still exist but there are collectors who are constantly looking to save parts and pieces of these virtually unknown vehicles. We learn about these rare cars from Geoff Hacker and his team at Forgotten Fiberglass, and take a visit to the Smithsonian Museum, which houses a fiberglass car of its own. This episode presents a unique look at how the narrative of American wartime experiences often shaped the nation’s automotive demands.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E8 DISCOVERIES IN JERSEY Ray explores buying a unique, hand built car the Schultz family has kept in their New Jersey home for years. The car was originally called the Schultz El Fierro but it’s officially titled in New Jersey as a “Schultz Special” from 1958. It was used to drag race and held numerous racing records, but most important to the family was that it was driven by the legendary Carroll Shelby. With a frame and style much similar to the Shelby Roadster, the Schultz family wonders if it inspired one of the most well known automobiles in America. In another epic New Jersey story, Ray finds Mario Andretti’s 1965 IndyCar. The catch: it’s completely in pieces hidden away in a garage. The iconic driver talks about his days on the track with that car and Ray attempts to negotiate a deal to buy the parts.

programme.title: What's In the Barn?
programme.desc: S2 E5 Second Time's a Charm The RM Auction Company has worked with Dale before as a buyer, seller, historian, and caretaker at the prestigious Lee Hartung auction. But this event is no last minute rush to define one man’s treasures. This is a well calculated, time consuming, multi-media, and multi motorcycle and prized art deal.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: S2 E3 Family Truckster Restoration Part 1 Nick Rutter walks you through step-by-step on how to remove stubborn bug splatter from your vehicle along with tips and techniques for using a waterless wash as well as a clay bar.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: S2 E4 Family Truckster Restoration Part 2 Nick Rutter provides tips and techniques for restoring dull, faded paint using a forced-rotation dual action polisher along with a graphene 3-in-1 ceramic polish, along with severe scratch and scuff removal.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E9 Better Than Stock Matt and Bruno are working on a 2006 Dodge Ram with a ton of problems…but why just make the repairs? Go better than stock!

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E10 Wheels For Hope Matt visits the Wheels for Hope Garage in Raleigh, NC and sees first hand how this organization is changing lives.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E11 Budget Rear End Matt and Bruno upgrade the Dana 35 rear end in a 2000 Jeep TJ to a much stronger Ford 8.8 one and do it for under $500.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E12 Warning Lights Every light on your dashboard means something. Matt and Bruno diagnose and repair a vehicle that came to the shop to them with warning lights.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E13 Road Ranger Nobody likes to fix a truck on the side of the road. That’s why there’s roadside assistance. Matt and Bruno take a stock F250 and turn it into a purpose-built Road Ranger.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E14 Jeep Build-Off Day 1 With two days and a ton of truck parts anything can happen. Matt and Bruno put together build teams to see who can complete the toughest rig.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E15 Jeep Build-Off Day 2 The Jeep Build-Off continues as the guys get a chance to finish their Jeeps and take them on a Geocaching race for all of the marbles.

programme.title: Truck U
programme.desc: S7 E16 Jeep Build-Off Day 3 The Jeep Build-Off continues as the guys get a chance to finish their Jeeps and take them on a Geocaching race for all of the marbles.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E9 MOVIE CARS How do you cast a car in a movie? What are the secrets to the build? Hollywood car designers give Ray the ultimate tour of some memorable movie cars, including a look at the recently found “Hells Chariot”, the last surviving car from Grease. We also hear the backstory to “Bumble Bee” from Transformers, take a look at the making of the tanks for Hunger Games and stumble upon the iconic 1958 Chevy Impala from American Graffiti.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S2 E10 HOT ROD HOLY GRAIL While visiting the estate of automotive genius and land speed record holder Willie Glass, Ray uncovers a set of extremely rare Ardun cylinder heads, which is a hot rodders dream discovery. He also visits the infamous H & H Flatheads outside of Los Angeles and discovers a surprise connection to the Earnhardt family.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S3 E1 CORVETTE SINK HOLE A massive sinkhole opened underneath the National Corvette Museum in Kentucky. Eight amazing cars were swallowed up, including the 1,000,000th Corvette. AmeriCarna was given exclusive access to document the removal of the cars from the sinkhole and the painstaking restoration of the 1,000,000th Corvette.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S3 E2 ROAR AT THE SHORE On the beaches of Wildwood, NJ, an iconic vintage race, The Race of Gentleman, takes place annually: period cars, period dress, pure authenticity. Ray puts a car in the race with a very special driver, who turns out not to be a Gentleman.

programme.title: AmeriCarna
programme.desc: S3 E3 CARS AND MUSIC STARS Scott Borchetta, CEO and Founder of Big Machine Label Group, and his brother, Mark, love racing just as much as anyone. From Indy to Nashville, Ray finds he has a lot in common with the Borchetta brothers. This celebrity-filled episode features musicians Tim McGraw, Cassadee Pope and IndyCar driver Josef Newgarden.

programme.desc: S4 E402 Back to the future with a Majestic build from Fuller Moto that showcases 3-D printed parts, an electric motor, and hub-centric steering.

programme.desc: S5 E512 Super Cars at Course d'Elegance One of a kind cars at Amelia Island Caffeine & Octane.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S5 E513 A New Generation Takes over Amelia Island Caffeine & Octane Caffeine & Octane at Ameilia Island have everything from classic to extraterrestrial.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S6 E601 Voices: Blackberry Smoke A new season kicks off with some big numbers: Featuring the world's fastest C8 Corvette, an overpowered Cortina Mark I, and a Buick Regal with over 1,700 horsepower.

programme.desc: S6 E602 Voices: Bishop Rob Wright C & O: North America's most diverse car show: Featuring custom Bugs, John Kaase fire breathing '56 Fords, and Chevy Silverados touching 1000HP.

programme.desc: S1 E1 Episode 1 C & O Jacksonville: Featuring Hurley Haywood's Brumos Porsches, a street legal Indy car, and a dynamic '60 Olds.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S6 E603 Brumos Collection with Hurley C & O Jacksonville: Featuring Hurley Haywood's Brumos Porsches, a street legal Indy car, and a dynamic '60 Olds.

programme.desc: S6 E604 Graffiti Artist KBMER Jacksonville's C & O's colorful and quirky car culture.

programme.desc: S6 E605 Voices: Sport's Radio Legend, Mike Bell C & O: North America's greatest car show.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S6 E606 Voices: Killer Mike Caffeine & Octane: North America's greatest car show.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S6 E607 Fuller's Fab 5 Amelia Island's own Caffeine & Octane car show,: Featuring $2,000 Wrek Racing Truck, David Patterson's favorite C&O cars, a plastic Citroen Mehari, and much more.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S6 E608 Generation Amelia The Concours d'Elegance from Amelia Island: Featuring bomb-proof Conquest Knight XV, '69 Camaro Hagerty Fixer-Upper, and car-enthusiast John Oates.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S1 E101 Delta Wing Racer with a Vengeance State-of-the-art engineering and passion projects take center stage on this edition of Caffeine & Octane. The revolutionary Delta Wing Racer turns on hot lap after hot lap at Road Atlanta, and driver Katherine Legge offers insight on how “less is more” when it comes to power to weight ratios; the dark world of a graffiti artist paints a picture of a car called Vengeance while the hosts share the eclectic hybrids of machines that make it to Caffeine and Octane with Vengance’s creator Totem.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S1 E102 Henry Ford III & Counterfeit Cars The word is out that Caffeine & Octane is the ultimate scene and the place to be seen. Even after 12 hours of racing at the Petit Le Mans endurance race, Henry Ford III, the great grandson of Henry Ford the industrial magnate and current member of Ford’s Board of Directors, showed up to take in the sights, address the crowds, and sign a one of a kind Ford Shelby GT350R. The GT350R will hit the road with Operation Hope to encourage young people to study math and science through motorsports; Covert car counterfeiter, Chuck Beck looks for Ford’s approval on his own version of a muscled up Festiva. YouTuber ‘That Dude in Blue’ David Patterson joins Skip and Bryan to get a special look at the motor-based philanthropic outreach and amazing cars that come with it done by John Hope Bryant, friend of Caffeine and Octane.

programme.title: Caffeine & Octane
programme.desc: S1 E103 Go Fast Collections Rickey and Bryan race outside of their comfort zones, each competing to find the raddest car collection. Rickey hangs out with classic racer, Ron Green, who shows him the ropes in the ultra light '83 Ralt RT5. Bryan visits a collection of 120 racing motorcycle owned by mechanic and racer Mike McConville. Mike takes Bryan motorcross racing in his backyard after showing off his high horsepowered car collection. Caffeine and Octane alongside Ron Green visit Atlanta's first Concours d'elegance to look at classic cars that have been perfectly maintained for decades.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: S2 E5 Family Truckster Restoration Part 3 Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how super clean automotive upholstery, as well as the proper chemicals and detailing tools for deep cleaning vinyl and rubber surfaces.

programme.title: Rutter's Detailin Garage
programme.desc: S2 E6 Family Truckster Restoration Part 4 Nick Rutter provides valuable tips and techniques for how to polish automotive glass as well as water spot removal and selecting the right polisher for the detailing job.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E3 F Sport Performance Upgrades Kevin and Bryan take a Lexus IS250 and add the latest FSport performance products from front to back - taking IS performance to the next level.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E4 2004 Corvette Project Ken Schrader drops off a 2004 Corvette that is in need of some TLC.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E5 G-Oil Kevin calls on his friends at Green Earth Technologies to learn about G-Oil and see how it is made.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E6 Pace Setter Kevin and Bryan throw a couple hundred horses at a 2010 Camaro pace car with a new supercharger.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E7 2004 Corvette Gets Shocked Kevin and Bryan upgrade the Federated Corvette with new suspension components.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E8 Hot Hybrid High MPG doesn’t have to be boring. Kevin and Bryan add a few of their own touches to a new Prius.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E9 Car Collector Appreciation Day Kevin heads out to California for a special car show celebrating the spirit of the car collector.

programme.title: Two Guys Garage
programme.desc: S10 E10 2004 Corvette Upgrades Back to work giving our corvette a little extra horsepower.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E4 Runnin' Down a Dream Mark receives an angry call from the owner of the 1970 Roadrunner, which leads to a mad rush to get the car finished in time. Meanwhile, Josh pushes the crew into committing to some New Years resolutions.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E5 More than a Wrench Frustrated by the crew's complaints that he spends all day being lazy in the front office. Mark is determined to prove to the guys that there is more to restoring a car than physical labor. Josh and Daren visit the crash site of the mangled orange 1971 'Cuda.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S1 E6 The Big Dipper As the team works to complete a multitude of cars, Mark stresses over the metal dipping of the very rare and valuable ʻ71 Cuda 440-6. Tensions are high and time is limited, is the GYC crew up to the pressure?

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E1 It's Alive The ghouls get the remains back from the '71 440 Six Barrel, 4 Speed, Shaker Hood Phantom Cuda and determine if the car can be resurrected. A '69 Dodge Daytona Charger arrives ready to be brought back from the dead and Mark gets a 2011 SRT8 Dodge Challenger.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E2 Six-Pack to Go The ghouls get the N96 Air Grabber installed on the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car. It's started and is ready for final assembly. The owners of '70 Cuda 383 Automatic FE5 Rallye Red Car visit to check on the restoration progress.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E3 Hey, Charger! Mark is hired to restore the body, paint, and suspension of a '70 AAR Cuda 340 Six Barrel car. The shop gets some needed upgrades and the '71 Charger 440 Six Pack Triple Green car is completed to OEM Specifications.

programme.title: Graveyard Carz
programme.desc: S2 E4 Wet Paint The '70 Sunroof Challenger is painted and ready for final assembly. The '69 Daytona Charger is disassembled and readied to be shipped to the media blasters. Mark and the Ghoulz head out to the junkyard to blow off some steam playing paintball.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S05E11 Precious Metal While attending the Pomona Swap Meet and Classic Car Show, David falls in love with a 1954 Fiat 500 Topolino, but the Lowriders are what really get his attention; they head to San Diego where David gets to ride in a 1966 Lamborghini 400 GT.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S05E12 Army Restoration The Canadian military approach The Guild to help restore a 1940s FAT field artillery tractor to be used for military funerals; the army mechanics at the 2nd Regiment Royal Canadian Horse Artillery in Petawawa, Ontario work on the FAT's body.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S06E01 Forming a Bond David is in California for the Pebble Beach Concours; the original 1965 James Bond DB5 breaks records at auction.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S06E02 Goodbye Rat Rod David believes a '73 Lincoln should have stayed in the barn where it was found; Ron tries to figure out the brakes on a '63 Riviera, while Mel finishes a special paint shade.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S06E03 Put to the Test Scotty completes full engine repair and test drive of 1966 Plymouth Belvedere; Brad is almost finished with 1956 Jaguar XK 140 when he discovers he can't get replacement brakes.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S06E04 More Than a Car Brad finishes a 1964 Pontiac GTO whose owner passed away shortly after the work started; when the family arrives with the owner's ashes and a plan to drive back in the car, they are overwhelmed by the beautiful work on the GTO.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S06E05 Road Rally Chaos David and Janice travel to France for the 80th anniversary of the Circuit des Remparts car show, race and rally; back at the shop, a few of the guys talk through restorations they've done on their own cars.

programme.title: The Guild Garage
programme.desc: S06E06 Cyclecars and Citroens David and Janice's discoveries in France include a 1913 Sizaire-Berwick, a 1914 cyclecar and an incredibly ornate 1952 hearse; back at the garage, Ron struggles with a 1963 Corvette that has had too much work done over the years.

programme.title: The Guild Garage

programme.title: College Basketball : Illinois at Iowa
programme.desc: The No. 16 Fighting Illini visit the No. 19 Hawkeyes for a high-stakes Big Ten rivalry game at Carver-Hawkeye Arena. The Illinois team looks to extend a winning streak, while the Iowa squad attempts to protect its home court after a recent slip.

programme.title: Road to the IndyCar Championship
programme.desc: S01E01 Closing the Gap Palou dominates with 5 wins in 6 races, eyeing the championship; 26 rivals, led by Kirkwood, aim to end his historic run as Team Penske battles scandal and McLaughlin fights to rebound.

programme.desc: S01E02 Breaking Point Palou leads as IndyCar heats up; Penske faces chaos, Power's future is unclear, and Malukas rumors swirl; O'Ward wins big, Kirkwood fights on; Toronto looms large in the title chase.

programme.title: The 109th Running of the Indianapolis 500

programme.title: Rising

programme.title: NHL Hockey : Vegas Golden Knights at San Jose Sharks ᴸᶦᵛᵉ
programme.desc: The Vegas Golden Knights visit the San Jose Sharks at SAP Center for a Pacific Division matchup. Vegas leads the series 3-0 this season. The Sharks look to Macklin Celebrini, who ranks third in the league with 64 points and 23 goals this season.
